snippet: The infrastructure that supports the Internet, online commerce and nearly all corporate data services is engaged in a vast migration eastward in search of energy prices cheaper than anything available in Silicon Valley, according to a report released...
abstract: The infrastructure that supports the Internet, online commerce and nearly all corporate data services is engaged in a vast migration eastward in search of energy prices cheaper than anything available in Silicon Valley, according to a report released Tuesday by the environmental group Greenpeace.

headline.main: Online Cloud Services Rely on Coal or Nuclear Power, Report Says
